com.cheetah.recorder

Class MQTTLatencyClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cheetah.recorder.MQTTLatencyClient

  • public class MQTTLatencyClient
extends java.lang.Object
    MQTTLatencyClient is a wrapper class for Paho's MqttAsyncClient Class. Initializes and defines the callbacks for an MqttAsyncClient Object, and stores the subscribe topic, broker address and client ID.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0, 2019-12-04
    Author:
    Alex Gaudreault

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  MQTTLatencyClient.MessageProcessor
      MessageProcessor class implements the IMqttMessageListener interface from the Paho library.

      Memory persistence structure for client

      The MQTT QoS level being used by client when publishing and subscribing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MQTTLatencyClient

        public MQTTLatencyClient()
        Unimplemented/Unused

      • MQTTLatencyClient

        public MQTTLatencyClient(java.lang.String broker,
                         java.lang.String id,
                         java.lang.String topic,
                         int qos,
                         java.io.File outFile)
        The initalization constructor for the MQTTLatencyClient class. Takes the required parameters from the calling method, to initalize an instance of client (MqttAsyncClient Object). Connected this client to the broker and subscribes to [topic] with a QoS level of [qos], before scheduling our emptyBucket Timer object.
        Parameters:
        broker - The address of the MQTT broker to subscribe to.
        id - The Identifier to be used by this client.
        topic - The topic which will be subscribed to with QoS [qos].
        qos - The QoS level which will be used when subscribing/publishing to the broker.
        outFile - The output file where the latency results will be logged (.csv).
        Since:
        1.0.0
